commitResults.messageBody:
Implement the initial structure for the edit-group command.
Currently, the command only throws an exception as the underlying
storage logic for groups is not yet implemented. Future commits will
integrate it with the add-group command's storage mechanism.

have created to view them.

to List feature that was previously there.

Both functionality works similarly in the sense
they are both listing objects to the users.

No frontend have been done yet and should be
implemented in the future.

commitResults.messageBody:
Implement functionality to create new groups in the address book.

- Create AddGroupCommand to handle group creation
- Create AddGroupCommandParser to parse command input
- Update Model interface with addGroup method
- Implement addGroup in ModelManager
- Add addGroup method to AddressBook class

This allows users to create new empty groups which can later be populated with members using existing functionality.

Closes #43

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: reordered import statements in AddressBookParser.
fix: update ModelStub in AddCommandTest with addGroup method
feat(UI): Display first 3 members in group list view
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add truncated member display in GroupCard showing up to 3 members
- Add "and X more" indicator for groups with >3 members
- Include member count label for each group
- Update GroupListCard.fxml with new layout elements
- Add CSS styling for member display

Improves group overview without requiring click interaction.

Solves #85

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: Add missing newlines at EOF in GroupCard and GroupListCard
fix: Fix Checkstyle issues in GroupCard.java
commitResults.messageBody:
- Reorder imports to follow lexicographical order
- Remove unused java.util.stream.Collectors import

Solves #85

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(ui): add space in between member names

commitResults.messageBody: fix(ui): add space in between member names

Add functionality to view attendance records of a person in a specific group.

- Create ShowAttendanceCommand to display attendance data
- Create ShowAttendanceCommandParser to handle command input
- Create AttendanceDisplay model to store attendance data for UI
- Create AttendanceCard UI component to render attendance
- Add FXML layout and CSS styles for attendance display

The command follows the pattern:
show-attendance p/PERSON_NAME g/GROUP_NAME

Closes #102
